sentences.en: A common example of mechanical resonance is provided by pushing a swing.
sentences.cn: 荡秋千,是熟知的机械共振的例子.

sentences.en: a tradition that has little resonance in the 21st century
sentences.cn: 在21世纪难以引起共鸣的传统

sentences.en: Damping wakes possible finite steady - state vibration amplitude at resonance.
sentences.cn: 在共振时,阻尼可能限制稳定振动的振幅.

sentences.en: Double - headed arrows are used to indicate resonance.
Her voice had a strange and thrilling resonance.
sentences.cn: 她的声音洪亮，有一种奇特的震撼人心的效果。

sentences.en: His voice had lost its resonance; it was tense and strained.
sentences.cn: 他的声音不再洪亮，而是显得紧张，不太自然。

sentences.en: His words will have resonance for many musicians.
sentences.cn: 他的话将在很多音乐家心里产生共鸣。

sentences.en: In nuclear resonance, the nucleus is disturbed by motions.
sentences.cn: 在核共振中核子受到运动的干扰.

sentences.en: It was this cloistral hush which gave our laughter its resonance.
sentences.cn: 是这种幽幽的寂静使我们朗朗的笑声发出回响.

sentences.en: Playing the piano sets up resonance in those glass ornaments.
sentences.cn: 一弹钢琴那些玻璃饰物就会产生共振.

sentences.en: Resonance theory says that benzene can be represented by two contributors.
sentences.cn: 共振论认为苯能用两个参与体表示.

sentences.en: The areas under the two resonance envelopes are unequal.
sentences.cn: 两个共振峰下面的面积是不相等的.

sentences.en: The ear has a set of filaments to vibrate in resonance with incoming sound-waves.
sentences.cn: 耳朵里有一组细丝能和进入的声波产生共振。

sentences.en: The resonance integral is often called an exchange integral.
sentences.cn: 共振积分常常叫做交换积分.

sentences.en: The various harmonics are in resonance in this cavity to different degrees.
sentences.cn: 在口腔中,各种谐音的共鸣程度不同.

sentences.en: Theoretically the absence of damping results in an infinite response at resonance.
sentences.cn: 在理论上,无阻尼时将引起无尽的谐振响应.

sentences.en: Tuning a radio or television receiver is an example of electrical resonance.
sentences.cn: 调谐收音机或电视接收机是电共振的例子.

words.tran_cn: [声] 共鸣器，共鸣体；共振器
产生共鸣；回响（resonate 的ing形式）

phrases.tran_cn: 回旋共振；[物]回旋加速器谐振
共振频率；谐振频率；共鸣频率

trans.tran_en: the special meaning or importance that something has for you because it relates to your own experiences
